text: I was having a talk with a friend about tech stuff and mentioned a few things worth looking at. 1. Fat Web Pages, which were a way of distributing script bits via the web in the 90s. 2. Postel's Robustness Principle, a cornerstone of web interop. 3. Simple Cross-Network Scripting, another development project in the 90s, that made it almost as easy to call a procedure over the net as it was to call one on your own machine. I really should write a book with some of these projects and the philosophy behind them.
